The man behind a few of our favourite classics like Ghostbusters, Spies Like Us and The Blues Brothers is semi-retired today, however donât depend Dan Aykroyd out of the sport just yet.

He has a net price of $200 million and a history with some of the most famous comedians so far, together with Chevy Chase, Bill Murray, John Belushi and John Candy.

Aykroyd is one in all the original individuals of Saturday Night Live (SNL) and created the long-standing Blues Brothers franchise, showcasing his screenwriting, song and performing abilities. He co-founded the House of Blues live performance venue/restaurant chain and introduced Crystal Head Vodka in 2007.

Check out the top grossing motion pictures Aykroyd has gave the impression in over the course of his profession.

Coneheads â $21 Million

While it wasnât a blockbuster, the movie led by means of Aykroyd and Jane Curtin follows aliens that crash-land on Earth and comedy ensues. Based off of a well-liked SNL skit, other famous comedians like Adam Sandler and David Spade can also be noticed all through the film.

Spies Like Us â $60 Million

According to Celebrity Net Worth, the film was once written via Aykroyd and starred himself and Chevy Chase as two government employees used as decoys for nuclear battle. Just one year after the blockbuster Ghostbusters, Aykroyd once again proves his skill in writing some vintage comedy and adventure.

The Great Outdoors â $41 Million

Opposite the past due comic John Candy, Aykroyd performs the obnoxious brother-in-law ruining the circle of relatives vacation Candy so desperately wants to move easily. Racoons, a big endure and a steak eating contest keeps audiences giggling.

Aykroyd and John Belushi take their wildly fashionable SNL skit about two brothers reuniting their former R&B band to save lots of a Catholic house where the men have been raised. Blues Brothers spawned further films, a real band with a success albums or even a restaurant, House of Blues, owned by means of the superstar.

Dragnet â $57 Million

Opposite Tom Hanks, Aykroyd plays Joe Friday, a unique and laid-back detective. The two pair as much as clear up a criminal offense in the film written through Aykroyd, but Hanksâs persona can barely stand his partners antics throughout the investigation.

My Girl â $60 Million

The stars of the film are a young Macaulay Culkin and Anna Chlumsky and an unlikely friendship. Aykroyd takes a supporting function as Chlumskyâs father, a funeral house director with a singular point of view on existence and guiding his pre-teen.

He performs the nosy and reasonably controlling neighbor to Tim Allen and Jamie Lee Curtisâ lead characters in a classic Christmas story about appreciating circle of relatives, pals and those that support you right through the crazy vacation hum drum.

According to IMDb, a snobbish investor performed by way of Aykroyd and a con artist (Murphy) in finding their positions reversed in a vintage Freaky Friday-like film. They find out about the trials and situations the different life leads, helping each and every other alongside the approach.

Driving Miss Daisy â $106 Million

An previous Jewish girl played by Jessica Tandy and her chauffeur (Morgan Freeman) have a dating that grows more potent over the years. Aykroyd plays Boolie Werthan, the older son of Tandy who cares for his mother, but not necessarily in the approach she would like.

Ghostbusters II â $112 Million

In the 2nd of a large franchise, Aykroyd and the original crew return to combat ghosts in a comedy and action film audiences had expected for 5 years after the first film. According to Looper, Aykroyd has at all times been hooked in to the paranormal, claiming he believes in UFOâs, spiritual encounters and even Bigfoot.

Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom â $180 Million

Aykroyd took a small position in the 1984 film as Art Weber, the airport team of workers who secured a flight for Indiana Jones (Harrison Ford) that used to be wearing are living poultry. The movie follows Jones on an journey in India as he stumbles upon a secret cult with human sacrifices and the hero finds a mythical stone in spite of the wild experience.

Pearl Harbor â $198 Million

As Captain Thurman, Aykroyd displays his critical facet in an epic historical drama starring Ben Affleck, Kate Beckinsale and Josh Hartnett. The film follows two buddies and an exquisite nurse caught up in the horror of the morning of 1941.

Ghostbusters â $238 Million

He wrote the screenplay for himself and best friend John Belushi. Upon Belushiâs untimely demise, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis, Ernie Hudson and Bill Murray joined the workforce, creating a cult classic that has spawned further films, merchandise and a following in contrast to weâve noticed sooner than in 1984.
